title._content: An anonymous letter written to Lord Monteagle, warning him to stay away from Parliament which ‘shall receive a terrible blow’.

description._content: Description: An anonymous letter written to Lord Monteagle, warning him to stay away from Parliament which ‘shall receive a terrible blow’. Monteagle took the letter straight to the government. As a result, King James' men decided to search the Palace, and discovered the Gunpowder Plot. We have a lesson on The Gunpowder Plot here: www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/education/lessons/lesson07.htm Date: 1605 Our Catalogue Reference: SP14/216/2 This image is from the collections of The National Archives. Feel free to share it within the spirit of the Commons. For high quality reproductions of any item from our collection please contact our image library: images@nationalarchives.gsi.gov.uk
